postage.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the money charged for sending a letter, package etc by post
postage.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: How much is the postage for a postcard?
It’s yours for £13.99, including postage and packing.
postage.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the money charged for delivering letters, parcels etc
postage.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The industry’s biggest cost variables are postage, paper and printing.
The annual subscription is $60, plus $2 postage and handling.
postage.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if you send a postage paid envelope, card etc to a company, the cost of sending it has already been paid and there is no need to use a stamp
postage.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Every month, more than 200 people receive the survey, which comes with a postage paid return envelope.
postage.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a charge made for the cost of packing and sending something you have bought
postage.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: All books are offered at 20% below publishers’ prices (plus postage and packing).
postage.translation[1].definitions[3].de: a charge made for the cost of packing and sending something you have bought
